pullRequest.body:
From https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9267#discussion_r1451605191:
> I would prefer we use lattice operations for adding edges. The idea is to make constructor `SimpleGraph.edge (v w : V) : SimpleGraph V` that creates a graph with a single edge between `v` and `w` if they're not equal (and no edge if they are), and then `G.addEdge v w` would instead be `G âŠ” edge v w`. This is more versatile, though perhaps lemmas such as `addEdge_of_adj` are a bit more brittle to apply.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

This is pretty cool. I assume we can delete an edge with `G \ edge v w` too?
This is pretty cool. I assume we can delete an edge with `G \ edge v w` too?
Thanks for following up on this idea. Once you get that spacing fixed, and decide how to address `edge_self_eq_bot`, we'll merge.

Nit:

```suggestion
lemma edge_edgeSet_of_ne (h : s â‰  t) : (edge s t).edgeSet = {s(s, t)} := by
```

I see a lot of logical manipulation. Would something like

```lean
  rw [edge_adj, bot_adj]
  tauto
```

work here?
